unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment program. As of today, 15,000 smart meters have been installed in Pune and Nagpur under the initial phase, with plans to scale up to 20 lakh meters by December 2024.
normalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution C O. Limited (MSEDCL) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment program. As of today, fifteen thousand smart meters have been installed in Pune and Nagpur under the initial phase, with plans to scale up to twenty lakh meters by December two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: The initiative aims to reduce AT&C (Aggregate Technical & Commercial) losses, currently estimated at 18% across the state. These smart meters enable real-time monitoring of electricity consumption, facilitating prompt identification of faults and theft. Consumers can also track their usage through a dedicated app, promoting energy conservation.
normalised: The initiative aims to reduce A T and C (Aggregate Technical and Commercial) losses, currently estimated at eighteen percent across the state. These smart meters enable real-time monitoring of electricity consumption, facilitating prompt identification of faults and theft. Consumers can also track their usage through a dedicated app, promoting energy conservation.

unnormalised: MSEDCL anticipates a significant reduction in billing errors and improved customer satisfaction. A consumer awareness campaign is scheduled for Diwali, on 12/11/2023, at 10:00 hrs to educate the public on the benefits of smart meters. Furthermore, tender negotiations are ongoing for the next phase, with bids expected to be finalized by 30/09/2023. The project, budgeted at Rs. 5000 crore, is a key component of the central government's Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS). The aim is to have the complete state under smart meter coverage by 2025. This initiative promises better grid stability and paves the way for wider adoption of renewable energy sources, fulfilling the vision of "Atmanirbhar Bharat" in the energy sector as envisioned by the Prime Minister on 15/08/2023.
